image.altText: Two young girls wearing pony tails and green uniforms smile at their desks, one with a MacBook and the other handwriting.

props.synopsis: Specialised year 9 programs are designed to help students get through the "lost year" in education through outdoor challenges and rites of passage.

title.children: Year 9 is often referred to as the 'lost year' amid hormones and puberty, but this school gives students their own campus

props.synopsis: The Labor opposition says it wants to see a ban on "pork barrelling", to ensure community grants are funded at arm's length from politicians, but the premier says the proposal is "breathtaking in its hypocrisy".

title.children: Tasmanian Labor promises to ban 'pork barrelling', in a move labelled 'bull crap' by the premier

image.altText: Printed photos of a bag and a gun and a camera are seen taped to a wall

props.synopsis: The FBI says Donald Trump was the target of what appears to be an attempted assassination at his golf club in West Palm Beach, Florida. This is what we know.

title.children: What we know about the second apparent assassination attempt on Donald Trump

image.altText: Four men, one in uniform, stand near shrubs behind police tape

props.synopsis: Investigators say a Secret Service agent opened fire on a gunman at Trump's Florida golf course after seeing a rifle barrel poking through a fence while the former president was on the course. A suspect has been taken into custody. Follow live.

title.children: Suspect in custody after apparent second attempt to assassinate Trump, FBI says

image.altText: A digital collage of a bald man sitting holding a glass of wine, with hand tattoos. Behind, holes are punched in a background.

props.synopsis: For three weeks, police recorded as a group allegedly orchestrated the murder of Alen Moradian – one of Australia's most feared organised crime figures.

title.children: For three weeks a group was recorded allegedly plotting to kill this man. Why didn't police stop them?

image.altText: A man looks into the camera with a solemn expression, in a portrait taken in a park.

props.synopsis: In 2015, ASIC warned Australia's banks to watch out for an overseas investment scam and take action to prevent people falling victim to it. Months later, David Sweeney's father lost $1 million to the very same scheme.

title.children: David's father lost $1 million to an overseas scam. Months earlier, banks were told to block it

image.altText: A composite image of close up shots of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: Last week the prime minister finally sounded like he was setting the agenda rather than constantly dodging hits, but a question from the US presidential debate could prove dangerous closer to the election.

title.children: There's one question from the US debate that could prove dangerous in Australia's next election

image.altText: James Packer wears a suit and tie, standing next to Lachlan Murdoch in suit and tie and a yellow scarf

props.synopsis: James Packer and Lachlan Murdoch have tracked similar highs and lows, all the while remaining very different characters, but if we are all stamped early on, their defining characteristic is that they grew up in the long shadow cast by their famous fathers.

title.children: The moment that almost ended James Packer and Lachlan Murdoch's friendship

image.altText: A man in puffer jacket and beaning holding up an electric car V2L cord.

props.synopsis: A reverse-charging feature on his electric vehicle allows Marcus Yong to power his fridge, charge his family's devices and even run his smart bike during blackouts.

title.children: Did you miss? | Tasmania's blackouts not a problem for homes powered by reverse-charging electric cars

image.altText: Sue La Velle

props.synopsis: In a suburb in Hobart's outskirts, photos and a box of ashes are all Sue La Velle has after her son was found dead in June. She's sharing her story for the first time in the hope it will prevent others from meeting the same fate.

title.children: A synthetic opioid more potent than fentanyl is spreading across Australia with fatal consequences

image.altText: damaged overhead powerlines

props.synopsis: Lengthy delays to a return of power for tens of thousands of Tasmanians during recent wild weather will be the topic of an independent review, as the state looks to learn from response shortcomings.

title.children: Tasmanians left with extended power outages to have say as independent inquiry passes first hurdle

image.altText: Frances Rodger and her husband Ed, and their cat in a selfie photo, Tamworth, 2024.

props.synopsis: The silence around menopause has long been the norm in rural Australia — now a new generation of women are trying to reshape attitudes and services around this normal, natural phase of life.

title.children: 'Two years in the wilderness' could have been solved by the right menopause care, but still regional women suffer in silence

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: Grants have been approved for the first 13,700 social and affordable homes under a government housing fund set up one year ago.

title.children: Thousands of social homes get government green light but Senate set to reject first home buyer help

image.altText: A close up of Kate Moegel smiling in a restaurant wearing a black top.

props.synopsis: In popular tourist areas far from major cities, a lack of affordable accommodation for workers has seen staff jammed into unsuitable housing. But a new investment model for worker housing hopes to fix the problem.

title.children: Australia has a worker housing shortage. Now companies are turning to old infrastructure for solutions

image.altText: A group of women in Japanese traditional wear walk past two women in face masks in an ornate temple.

props.synopsis: Recent data shows a 32 per cent rise in outbound travel in the year to June, compared to the previous year, with Australians taking more than 11 million trips.

title.children: What is revenge travel? New data shows Aussies have made a habit of it

image.altText: F1 driver Oscar Piastri standing on the winner's step of the podium with a gold medal around his neck

props.synopsis: After being told by his team that he would need to prioritise his teammate, Oscar Piastri shows he is a lead driver at McLaren with victory in Azerbaijan.

title.children: Australian Piastri proves he is a leader with win, as late crash ends Ferrari and Red Bull fight

image.altText: Picture of Jina Amini during protest

props.synopsis: While the world is focused on other parts of the Middle East, the Iranian people are fighting their own battles against a harsh government crackdown on women who unveil, and a ramp up in arrests and use of the death penalty.

title.children: As the world's attention focuses on a regional war, Iran's women are fighting a 'quiet revolution'

image.altText: A group of older high school students ar work in a classroom.

props.synopsis: A NSW Catholic high school will allow senior students to learn from home one day a week permanently following a trial that found the program helped students become more independent despite concerns about a lack of structure.

title.children: Private school adopts four-day week permanently after successful trial

image.altText: Suzanne Curyer and her dogs; bonde woman smiling at camera; sitting on bed with two dogs

props.synopsis: Obstructive sleep apnoea is a common disorder that can have serious impacts, but most people don't even know they've got it. Here's a guide to getting help.

title.children: Struggling with sleep apnoea? An expensive CPAP machine might not be your only option

image.altText: A man gestures on stage with five other people in the background.

props.synopsis: The 2024 Emmys are here with The Bear beginning their award sweep and Australia's Elizabeth Debicki winning an award for her portrayal as Princess Diana in The Crown. Follow our live blog as we bring you the latest updates from the award show.

title.children: Emmys 2024 — Hacks pokes The Bear to win top comedy award as Shogun and Baby Reindeer dominate

image.altText: Two women standing on their front porch

props.synopsis: The ACT's new assisted reproduction technology laws were introduced to protect the wellbeing of donor-conceived people, but IVF patients and doctors say they're having unintended consequences for women now trying to fall pregnant with donated sperm.

title.children: Anna and Alex are desperate for a baby. New IVF donor laws have made that 'near impossible'

image.altText: An elevated view of the Big Red Bash campsite and stage area, the sun on the horizon in the background.

props.synopsis: From races and rodeos to festivals and fairs, event tourism is the lifeblood for many businesses in outback Queensland, but towns are bracing for a bleak tourism season next year as the cost of living crisis puts the crunch on iconic events.

title.children: Can outback tourism survive without one of its biggest events?

image.altText: An image of a girl studying at a computer with headphones, with pictures of famous composers overlaid on top.

props.synopsis: Here's what the science says about when music might help boost your performance, and when it might be better to stick with silence.

title.children: Does listening to music while you study help or hinder? It depends on what you're doing

image.altText: Kate O'Keeffe standing in front of a large blue tractor.

props.synopsis: Regional and remote councils in Western Australia had to spend nearly $8 million to attract and retain doctors locally. Experts say state and federal governments need to help with the high cost.

title.children: Rural councils are spending millions to bring GPs to their towns. Who should pay the bill?

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 has opened 0.4pc higher and is on track for a record close after Wall Street's positive lead as investors ponder the start of a new cycle of rate cuts from the US Fed. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX opens 0.4pc higher in record territory as Wall Street ends the week strongly ahead of Fed's rate cut

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200 up 0.4% heading towards a record close
ASX 200 opens 0.4% higher, edges into record territory
Is the ASX primed for a record close?

image.altText: Corflutes featuring ACT election candidates on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: The election starting gun has well and truly fired, corflutes are popping up and campaign leaflets are making their way into mailboxes across Canberra.

title.children: The corflutes are out and letterbox drops are underway. Here's what you need to know to vote in the ACT election

image.altText: A graphic with two mobile phones showing Steven Miles holding a sauce bottle on one and David Crisafulli eating an ice cream

props.synopsis: With the Queensland poll six weeks away, two of the state's key candidates have been tapping into the socials.

title.children: It's the 'year of the TikTok election' — and politicians are tapping in

image.altText: An older woman in an armchair with a health professional next to her, surrounded by ghost-like people

props.synopsis: Hospitalised in a public health psychiatric unit 30 times in six years, Christine wants urgent change to the mental health system. Her photographs re-imagined mental health conditions; now she is adamant her voice should be heard.

title.children: Christine's photographs captured 'invisible' mental illness. Then she had her own breakdown

image.altText: Giuliano Pirone sitting at a restaurant in a black collared shirt

props.synopsis: Bodybuilder Giuliano Pirone died after spending 15 hours unconscious in a gym shower. His mother Daniela Pirone says she doesn't want his death to be in vain, calling for tighter regulations for the gym industry.

title.children: 'A void in my heart': Perth mother reveals anguish of losing her son after he lay unconscious in gym shower for 15 hours

image.altText: Jordan Thompson speaks to Lleyton Hewitt courtside while looking frustrated

props.synopsis: Lleyton Hewitt's team may have already reached the finals, but Australia came up short in its final Davis Cup tie of the week in Valencia against hosts Spain.

title.children: Hewitt bemoans 'stupid' Davis Cup format as Australia ends positive week with defeat to host Spain

image.altText: Japanese composer Nobuo Umeatsu sits playing viola in a lounge surrounded by cds and musical equipment

props.synopsis: The Japanese composer’s groundbreaking music for the Final Fantasy franchise has reached the pop charts, concert halls and even the Olympics. Not bad for a self-taught musician.

title.children: Meet the 'Beethoven of video game music', Final Fantasy maestro Nobuo Uematsu

image.altText: A street filled with water.

props.synopsis: Days of torrential rain in a low-pressure system named Boris has caused rivers to overflow across the region.

title.children: Rivers overflow in Poland and Romania as 'dramatic' rain spell inundates Central Europe
